cheatsheet.title: Power Divisibility (32 example)
cheatsheet.body: To check if k^4 is divisible by 32 (2^5), k must have enough factors of 2. 4 * factors_in_k >= 5 -> k needs 2 factors of 2. Thus k is a multiple of 4.
cheatsheet.example: k^4 div by 32 implies k is multiple of 4.

flashcard.front: If k^4 is divisible by 32, what is the smallest multiple k must be?

quiz.p: Step 1: Understand 32. 32 = 2 to the power of what?
Step 2: If k has 'x' factors of 2, then k^4 has '4x' factors. We need 4x â‰¥ 5. What is the smallest integer x?
Step 3: If k has 2 factors of 2 (2^2), then k is a multiple of what number?

cheatsheet.title: Digit Counting
cheatsheet.body: Rewrite 4^x * 5^y as 2^(2x) * 5^y. Pair 2s and 5s to make 10s. The count is exponent + coeff digits.

quiz.p: We have 2^18 * 5^17. How many pairs of (2*5) can we form?

cheatsheet.title: Combined Range
cheatsheet.body: To minimize combined range, overlap intervals fully. Smallest combined = Largest individual.

flashcard.front: Two ranges 20 and 25. Smallest combined range?

quiz.p: To minimize range, how should the two sets relate?
If range 20 is inside range 25, what is the total width?

cheatsheet.title: Linear Penalty
cheatsheet.body: Penalty p per 10 units over L -> p * (x - L) / 10.

flashcard.front: Expression: 0.5 penalty per 10 units over 40 (Speed S).
